intro: Raddiella micrantha, commonly known as the small-leaved raddiella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth. Raddiella micrantha is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
